peopleAlsoAsk.question: How old are church bells?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: This would explain the attribution of the origin of church bells to Paulinus of Nola in AD 400. By the early Middle Ages, church bells became common in Europe, wrung singly (cymbalum) or in tuned sets (cymbalum).
